page.title: 02Farming in Stackpole
page.content: The Stackpole area contains a variety of types of farming.Included within its boundaries are dairy, beef, sheep, grain and early potato farms. There is also a horticulture business. Individual farms do not specialise but instead diversify into two or even more of the above products. Dairy,beef and sheep,the main industries,are now farmed in roughly the same proportions A farmer in the area describes the current state of the farming as being "in crisis".The introduction of EEC quotas in the dairy industry two years ago has meant a decrease in the amount of milk produced locally and therefore a derease in the income of the dairy farmer.One farm has subsequently changed to beef.The potato harvest has also been a disaster this year with potatoes beung allowed to rot in the fields.
